page.title: 02More about Beckermet
page.content: Although a predominantly rural area, it tends to be dominated by the Atomic Energy complex at Sellafield. Population is largely centred in the village of Beckermet and this is generally an area of populatiion growth the majority of families moving into the area are part of the workforce at Sellafield. Unemployment is virtually unknown. There are several wooded areas providing a natural habitat for much of the wildlife. Wild deer are sometimes found. Birds are always a familar sight. Round here there are Mistle Thrushes which nest in the school roof and swallows and Blue Tits which nest in nearby barns as well as in the school nesting box. Also there are some Pied Wagtails. We often see a few Heron around. There are lots of fishes like Trout in the rivers.
